title: Collaborative Teaching Strategies in Remote and Blended Learning Environments: Strengthening Science Education Leadership

context.prior_knowledge: Basic online class management experience and secondary education administration experience
context.additional_context: Course for science field managers/leaders to acquire collaborative teaching techniques across diverse classroom settings and develop student engagement strategies using technological tools

learning_goals: Learners can apply three or more technology-integrated instructional models to design collaborative classes in remote/blended environments.
Learners can improve student participation rates by 20% or more using digital tools (e.g., Mentimeter, Jamboard) that support small-group activities.
Learners can create consistent lesson design guidelines that reflect the needs of all learners, including those with disabilities.

resources: Collaboration tool licenses (Zoom, Mentimeter, Jamboard, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
